Buddhist Pantheon is a bit of a misnomer, although you do often hear it...
=
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Again, to put it simply :
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are =
not gods--- they are Buddhas. There is a sutra where Buddha denies being a =
god... and denies being a human. Why ? Because again--- Buddhas are a not p=
art of the six realms ... it is completely different category.
=C2=A0
=C2=
=A0=C2=A0 The different "gods" of Buddhism are, in reality,=C2=A0 gods and =
spirits that have been associated as SERVANTS of the Buddhas... that is, th=
ey themselves have become Buddhist in that they take refuge in the Buddha, =
Dharma, Sangha, and have agreed to serve the Buddha,=C2=A0 watch over the D=
harma, and protect the Sangha..etc.etc.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0 This is called "Worldy Protectors" .=C2=A0 Many gods from around the wo=
rld have become such "protectors".=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Now.. the question is.. what role do the Shino god=
s play ?
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Well.. it depends on wh=
o you talk to. 
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Some Shinto followers =
believe they are distinct from the Buddhas... some believe they are emanati=
ons of the Buddhas. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0 What is this deal with "emanation of the Buddha" ? ... Since Buddhas ha=
ve no actual form, they radiate illusory forms for the sake of sentient bei=
ngs.=C2=A0 Thus, a single buddha might take a hundred different forms (such=
 as four arms, thousand arms.. one head version, three head version, etc.et=
c.)
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 
=C2=
=A0Some Shinto followers believe that the Shinto Gods were actually the ema=
nations of Buddhas.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 O.k.. here is where there is =
a critical line :
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Th=
ere is no dharma text or tradition supporting this claim--- outside of cert=
ian Japanese religious/political leaders and scholars trying to support thi=
s idea.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 So... while many WANT to believe=
 this...
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
 It can actually be very easily dismissed as heretical ideology, since much=
 of the behavior of many of the Shinto gods cannot be viewed as enlightened=
 activity.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 When a Buddha emanates as a "Protector Deity"..=
 it is called "Dharma Protector" ( as opposed to "Worldy Protector")... and=
 these beings have all the attributes and qualities as the Buddha/Great Bod=
hisattvas...=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 The Shinto deities don't match up--- and thus we c=
an, from a Buddhist view point, say that there doesn't appear to be any rea=
son to believe they are Buddha's emanation ... this idea is more of an atte=
mpt to merge POLITICAL factions.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 So... if the Shinto deities are not Buddh=
a's emanations... what is the relationship ?
=C2=A0
=C2=A0Again--- they can=
 be considered servants of the Buddha/Great Bodhisattvas. Helpers...etc.etc=
..=C2=A0 a retinue of gods so to speak.
=C2=A0 
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Again.. -WHICH- deities=
 serve -WHICH- Buddhas is a very difficult topic..
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=
=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 Because.. just because you WANT you=
r Shinto god to become a servant of Buddha does not mean that the god in fa=
ct did....
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 So=
.. you must understand.. alot of this merging was POLITICAL=C2=A0 and not r=
eally based on any evidence, such as the deity appearing to its followers a=
nd stating that it now serves Buddha...etc.etc.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 This is when religion and =
politics SHOULD NOT run together...
=C2=A0
=C2=A0 But.. in the end... Buddh=
ist will still take refuge in the triple gem.. and they can, within the Dha=
rma, pay respect to the worldy gods...=C2=A0 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0so this doesn't =
really change much. 
=C2=A0
=C2=A0A shinto followers will continue to follo=
w worldy gods. which didn't really change much either.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0=C2=A0=
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 So=
.. in the end.. it really boils down to whether you want to worship Japan (=
Shinto) or whether you will pay respect to Japan, but follow the Buddha (Bu=
ddhism).
=C2=A0
=C2=A0 This is why, for=C2=A0 Meiji and WW2, you see his de=
cline of Buddhism and rise in Shinto... simple as that.
